alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 5:41PM EDT until June 16 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... The southeastern City of Norfolk in southeastern Virginia... The northeastern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 541 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 16 miles south of Cape Charles to near Princess Anne to near Great Bridge, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Regent University, Kempsville, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Princess Anne, Rudee Heights, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Oceana NAS, Macons Corner, Pungo, Greenbrier, Bayside, Oceana, North Virginia Beach and Dam Neck. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Virginia Beach
